Notes: Not horses. Maybe dogs and oxen?
Egypt
Base 60
According to Wikipedia, fermentation was used in 6000 BCE in China. Sigh.

Discovery / Invention: First surviving account of medical remedies
Notes: Eber’s Papyrus
Phonecian alphabet

Discovery / Invention: Dyes resistant to sun and water invented

Notes: Phonecians
Iron Age begins
Etruscans
Lydian government issued pieces of gold w/ standard weight
Unit isoceles right triangle with hypotenuse sqrt(1)
Early exploration of the Atlantic ocean
Earliest: Greece
I guess it’s significant that the evening star and morning star were identified...
Again, why is this here?

Discovery / Invention: Atoms theorized (the world is made of indivisible particles)

Notes: Hippocrates thought disease was due to a misbalance between the four humors: blood, phlegm, bile, black bile.
Appian Way

Discovery / Invention: Size of moon and sun estimated

Notes: Lighthouse of Alexandria (at Pharos)
Also estimated the value of pi to 3.142
Formerly "the seventh year of King X"

Discovery / Invention: Great Wall of China begun (should this be here?)

Notes: Previously papyrus, now animal skin.
Including magnitudes (brightnesses), included 1000 stars
Previously glass making was done by hand
First written mention, likely invented earlier. According to wikipedia, MUCH earlier.
Described 600 plants, 1000 drugs
Worked like a modern lawn sprinkler, had no bearing on society
Took 1000 years to reach Europe
Remained canon for 14nturies

Discovery / Invention: Understanding of spinal cord and other basic anatomy
Notes: Cut animals’ spines to see resulting paralysis
Fractions can be treated as numbers.
Reduced infection since it required water to be boiled
Unclear why this matters.
More stability for the rider, less chance to be thrown off horse in battle
Potentially much earlier than 400.
Hagia Sophia

Discovery / Invention: Silk came to Europe from China via Silk Road
Notes: Constantinople began silk production
A plow with a vertical knife-blade that cut deep into the earth. Useful for damp, moist ground, led to increase in carrying capacity

Discovery / Invention: Greek fire, a napalm like weapon for naval battle

Notes: Eventually came to Europe, known as “China” and replaced wood dishes
Found accidentally, while trying to find an alchemic elixir of life
(Outside of Asimov: Frankish King Childeric in 550)

Discovery / Invention: Zero first used in positional notation
Notes: Around 500 zero as a symbol was invented in India.
Muslims didn’t know about tea, couldn’t drink alcohol, so needed some water that was treated.

Discovery / Invention: First crossing into the arctic circle

Notes: Europe’s first expansion to new land overseas. Iceland first discovered around 550 by Brendan, an Irishman
Allowed horses to pull by their shoulders not their windpipe, increasing pulling capacity by 5x

Discovery / Invention: Human vision understood and vision correcting lenses invented
Notes: Foundation of the field of optics
First mechanized handheld weapon. Range of 300m, penetrated chainmail

Discovery / Invention: Creation of a new star witnessed
Notes: Went unnoticed in Europe
Used by the Chinese in war mostly to scare the mongols (not efficient weapons)
Originated in Byzantium, arrived in Venice. Replaced eating with fingers
St. Denis in 1137.
Actually invented around 700, brought to France from persia. Alternative power to water wheels

Discovery / Invention: Magnetic compasses first used for navigation
Notes: Thales of Greece discovered magnetixation of metal. Chinese discovered N-S orientation.
Extremely far north islands at 79 degrees N
Popularized by Fibonacci, but existed in parallel with Roman numerals for 3 centuries
First mined in Newcastle. Important in England since land was being deforested.

Discovery / Invention: Rudders for boats first used in Europe
Notes: Likely brought back from crusades. Widely used by ships of Hanseatic League
Invented in China around the same time. Only convex.
Perfected by Europeans to make it a serious weapon
More accurate than Ptolemy's geocentric model

Discovery / Invention: Magnetic poles discovered, magnetic compass improved
Notes: Proto-experimental science
Previously all glass was colored, but with clear glass, all it took was a backing metal surface
Far east became a wonder-goal for European dreamers
Previously done by hand, spinning wheels made the process much easier
Twice the range of a crossbow, far greater force. Big implications for war
Far stronger than acetic acid
Much faster than waiting for natural fermentation. Villanova made Brandy

Discovery / Invention: First realistic depiction of a comet
Notes: Seen by naked eye. Painted in "Adoration of the Magi"
Originally discovered in 40 BCE by King of Mauritania
After a ban, cadaver dissection became possible again
Weight-powered, more accurate than water clock. Hourly chimes
Primitive cannons used at siege of Metz
Venician policy to delay strangers from entering the city until a waiting period had passed (40 days)
Led expedition to Red Sea, India, Ceylon, brought back ruler of Ceylon as prisoner
Kicked off the European Age of Exploration
1/3 of the way to America. Like Madeira, originally uninhabited, also still part of Portugal
Book published about how to draw in perspective
Improved upon cannons. Artillery was good against city walls
First gun small enough to be fired by one person
Previous lenses (convex) were only for farsighted people
Proto-printing was done by Sumerians and Chinese
Comets usually viewed with terror, now understood rationally.

Discovery / Invention: Cape of Good Hope first charted
Notes: Initially called Cape of Storms, renamed as Good Hope by John II who knew it would open trade routes with orient

Discovery / Invention: New world discovered by modern Europeans
Notes: Funding from Spain, first landing: Bahamas.
Saw declination of the compass compared to the starts
Breakout during siege of Naples by France. Named after the protagonist of a poem that had syphilis.

Discovery / Invention: India water route discovered by Europeans
Notes: Lost 3/5 of crew to scurvy.
Realized they weren't in Asia
Allowed much smaller, non-vertical clocks
In search of asian wealth, crossed panama to get to the Pacific
First portion of USA to be settled by Europeans

Discovery / Invention: Mexico discovered and conquered by Spain
Notes: 17: Landed on Yucatan, traces of Maya 19: landed and went to war
Didn't know Magellan died in Guam, not technically finishing

Discovery / Invention: Peru first discovered and conquered by Spain
Notes: Spain held it for 3 centuries
Quadratic equations had been solved for a long time

Discovery / Invention: Comet tails always point away from the sun
Notes: News to me! Also independently discovered by Peter Bennewitz
Commisioned by Charles V
Actually went west to east, from Quito to Marajo
Still kept the concentric circle constraint the Greeks proposed but greatly improved math.
Published "Concerning the Structure of the Human Body" including illustrations of human anatomy

Discovery / Invention: Negative numbers first used to represent debt
Notes: Also negative integers, fractions, irrationals.
Improved surgical techniques, eg. tying off arteries rather than burning.
Built tables of angle ratios to make astronomy calculations easier
Used Copernicus' math to improve over previous planetary tables.
Described tube going from ear to throat, as well as adrenal glands published a new anatomy book
Landed in Archangelsk (so not quite the whole way to asia). Improved Russia-English trade relations
Noted that number of bones in limbs were often constant regardless of animal species. Foreshadowed evolution

Discovery / Invention: Wrote “Concerning Metallic Things” summarizing German mining knowledge.
Notes: Basically founded Mineralogy. Also contributed: Theophrastus Bombastus von Hohenheim (best name ever?)

Discovery / Invention: Europeans learned about Tobacco from Native Americans
Notes: Nicotine named after Nicot, ambassador to Portugal who sent tobacco seeds to France.

Discovery / Invention: First scientific association for idea exchange “Academy of the Mysteries of Nature”
Notes: Closed down by the inquisition shortly, but others formed later.

Discovery / Invention: Arquebus was further refined into a Musket, first weapon to pierce armor
Notes: Armor penetrating meant armor was obsolete. Muskets remained principle small arms for 2 centuries

Discovery / Invention: First map of the world created using a cylindrical projection (Mercator)
Notes: Main feature of Mercator projection: movement in a fixed compass direction appears as a straight line on the map. The cover of the book showed Atlas holding the world on his shoulders, this is why books of maps are called atlases.

Discovery / Invention: First supernova (birth of new star) observed
Notes: Observed the process over 485 days (until it became invisible). Notion of heavenly immutability destroyed.

Discovery / Invention: Failed attempt to find NW passage yielded Greenland instead
Notes: Discovered Baffin Island, and second time around, Greenland rediscovered. All Vikings settlers had died or left. No viable NW passage path

Discovery / Invention: Distance to comets proven to be far beyond previous notions
Notes: Greeks thought comets were atmospheric phenomenon (!), but Tycho saw no parallax in the comet’s trajectory, proving it was far.

Discovery / Invention: Discovered a passage around the southernmost tip of South America
Notes: Attempting to find Straight of Magellan, which weaves through South American continent (far south), Drake overshot and found an even more southern passage. Coming back around he got as far as SFBA. 60 years after Magellan this was only the second circumnavigation of the world.

Discovery / Invention: First inkling that pendulums might have good time-keeping properties
Notes: Most time keeping done via heart rate, dripping water, burning candle, etc. (Surprising, given mechanical watches previously invented)

Discovery / Invention: Driven by fur trade, Russia expanded east
Notes: Timofievich conquered last Mongol kingdom named Sibir. Eventually paved the way to Russians in the Pacific.

Discovery / Invention: Pope mandated a calendar switch, causing holidays to be more aligned with seasons
Notes: A leap year every 4 years means a year is 365.25 days, but it’s actually 365.2422 days long. To avoid error new calendar introduced a new rule. Instead of 1/4, 97/100 had to be leap years. To adjust for the offset, 10 days were dropped on October 4, 1582. The next day was October 15.

Discovery / Invention: Foundational experiment: pressure of liquid on surface depends on height of liquid and area of surface but not shape of vessel
Positional notation including decimals for tenths, hundredths etc columns
Notes: Greatly simplified calculations using fractions. Downside: infinitely repeating decimals (eg. 1/3)

Discovery / Invention: Definitive proof that objects fall at same acceleration regardless of their mass
Notes: Confusions stemmed from air resistance. Also showed that force not necessary to keep object in perpetual motion. Credited with founding experimental science.

Discovery / Invention: First knitting machine more efficient than by hand
Notes: Elizabeth I refused to grant a patent for fear of throwing hand knitters out of work. First example of technological unemployment.
Janssen, a spectacle maker first stacked two convex lenses to amplify the magnification.

Discovery / Invention: Algebraic symbol system proposed, using x and y for variables

Notes: Simple device consisting of a long glass tube with markings that drew water up into it. As water warmed, it crept higher into the tube.
Setup a factory at Palembang on Sumatra, starting the Dutch overseas empire
Archimedes estimated to 3.142, but van Ceulen got it to 20 and then 35 decimal places.
Described preparation of hydrochloride and sulfuric and nitric acid. Still Alchemy, but set stage for real chemistry.

Discovery / Invention: Discovery that Earth itself is a large magnet
Notes: Did a series of magnet-related experiments like disproving that garlic destroys magnetism and diamonds produce it.

Discovery / Invention: Discovery that veins have valves that prevent backflow
Notes: Galen’s doctrine was that blood was made in liver, carried to heart and pumped through arteries and veins. Fabrici found something else but didn’t dare to go against Galen

Discovery / Invention: Jamestown: first permanent English settlement in North America

Notes: Spectacle maker accidentally found that two lenses, one at a distance from another enabled him to see really far and upside-down.

Discovery / Invention: Quebec: first permanent French settlement in North America
Notes: Commissioned by Henry IV

Discovery / Invention: Discovery that planetary orbits aren’t circular but elliptical
Notes: Working under Tycho Brahe, Kepler found that his teacher’s data worked best for non-circular orbits with sun at one of the foci’s. Also developed Kepler’s laws.

Discovery / Invention: Discovery that the Milky Way is full of stars
Notes: Galileo replicated Lippershey’s telescope and peered into the Milky Way, discerning many small stars.

Discovery / Invention: Discovery that the moon has mousntains
Notes: Also with the help of his telescope, Galileo discerned dark spots on the moon t hat might have been seas. Ultimately it suggested that the moon wasn’t just a globe of light, but a world.

Discovery / Invention: Discovery that Jupiter has 4 moons orbiting it
Notes: Another point against egocentrism.

Discovery / Invention: Discovery that Venus has a full range of phases
Notes: The discovery strongly suggests heliocentric model.
Annoying to religious conservatives since the sun was supposed to be perfect.
Napier first produced a table of logarithms.

Discovery / Invention: Beginning of the study of biological metabolism
Notes: Self-experimented while eating and drinking, found he lost more weight than the weight of his feces and urine.
Came as far as 78 deg N, within 800 miles of North Pole, concluding that there was no practical NW passage. Furthest north for 2.5 centuries.
Sailed around the southern tip of Cape Horn, which is on a large island.
Apparently stagecoaches is a horse and carriage that follows a schedule, taking passengers between destinations for payment. (Wow, an early form of public transport)
Bacon laid out the foundation for the scientific method, going beyond logic. Formalized experimental science.
Well known that when a beam of light passes from air into water, it bends towards the vertical. Snel quantified it.

Discovery / Invention: Slide rules, a way to calculate logaithms
Notes: Predecessor to slide rules, which were actively used by scientists and engineers for 350 years (only replaced by pocket calculators)
Greeks had four elements, and any vapor was a kind of air. Helmont suggested that like different solids and liquids, there can be different “airs”.

Discovery / Invention: Best tables of planetary motion to date
Notes: Greatly improved by Napier’s logarithms, which was the first application of the technique.

Discovery / Invention: Closest ancestor of cattle became extinct
Notes: Not sure why this is here. But, Aurochs weren’t hunted deliberatey, just ran out of space due to domesticated cows.
“Concerning motion of heart and blood” published, in which circulation is described: right ventricle => lungs => left ventricle => all over body => right ventricle

Written in Italian (not Latin), “Dialog on the two chief world systems” was accessible to the public and created a huge stir. Copernicus-supporter was described favorably, Ptolemy-supporter laughed at. Pope forced Galileo to renounce his views.

Discovery / Invention: Discovery that magnetic north is spatally inconsistent
Notes: Discovered that magnetic north and geographic north aren’t the same, and that magnetic north shifts position over time.
Represented points in 2D space as pairs of coordinates, with graphs of functions first illustrated. Algebraic and geometric solutions. Laid foundation for calculus.
Conjectured that no 3 positive integers a, b, c exist such that a^n + b^n = c^n (for n > 2). Only proven 350 years later.

Discovery / Invention: First cross hairs used in the center of an optical scope
Notes: A specific spot could be located and accurately centered at the crossing point of two lines, increasing precision of telescope

Discovery / Invention: Quinine as treatment for malaria in Europe
Notes: Incas used bark of cinchona tree, in which active ingredient quinine treats malaria. Allowed Europeans to remain in tropical climates.
A series of wheels were connected in a clever way so when one rotation was made, the next wheel would turn. First patented in 1649 it was a commercial failure because it was too expensive.

Seeking a continent entirely in the Southern Hemisphere (predicted by Greeks), European explorers went south. Tasman discovered Indonesia, then Tasmania, then New Guinea and also South Island of New Zealand.

Major mining problem of the time was that water wouldn’t lift more than 33 ft. To investigate, Galileo’s assistant investigated it, and invented barometer. Cool experiment to boot. Also observed changes in atmospheric pressure over time.
First practical air pump worked liked a water pump, but more airtight. Used to create vacuums, showed that  in a vacuum, sounds couldn’t be heard, flame can’t burn. Estimated air’s density.

Discovery / Invention: Air pressure was found to depend on altitude
Notes: Pascal was too sick to go himself, so sent his brother in law up a mountain, saw mercury column descend from 30” to 27”. Showed atmosphere would have finite height of ~100 mi
Middle star of the Big Dipper is actually two stars very close together.

Discovery / Invention: Theologians decide earth created in 4004 BC
Notes: More specifically, 9am on October 26, 4004 BC (what time zone tho?)

Discovery / Invention: Features of the moon first named
Notes: Published a map of the moon in “New Algamest” and named craters of the moon after famous astronomers: Tycho, Copernicus, Ptolemaeus, and Kepler.

Veins and arteries well known, but a third type of vessel resembling veins was found. These vessels had thinner walls, carried “lymph”, or watery parts of blood. Took back interstitial fluid from outside of cells.

Consulting with Pascal and Fermat, a certain gambler wanted to understand why he kept losing at dice. These greats formulated a mathematics for considering a large number of random events, unpredictable on their own, but in predictable in aggregate.
Demonstrated power of air pressure through experiments: fifty men struggled to pull a cylinder out of a vacuum. Teams of horses tried to separate two hemispheres sealed in a vacuum.

Discovery / Invention: First clear sighting of Saturn’s ring
Notes: Build a large telescope (23ft long) with better lens grinding techniques, and were able to see Saturn’s rings, which eluded Galileo. Also saw Orion Nebula rather than a single star.

An ordinary pendulum swings in the arc of a circle and doesn’t have a constant period (?). But a cycloid trajectory enables a constant period. The clock involved counterweights and a cycloid always pendulum and could tell time far better than its predecessor.

Discovery / Invention: Experimental proof that all bodies fall at equal rates
Notes: Definitive experiment created a vacuum (mitigating air resistance) using an air pump and dropped feather and coin at the same time, and they fell at the same speed

Discovery / Invention: Red blood cells first seen in blood w/ microscope
Notes: Due to improvements in microscopes in 1650s, Swammerdam studied insects. Father of modern entomology (study of insects).

Discovery / Invention: Syrtis Major, a marking on Mars, first seen
Notes: Dark triangular marking on Mars
Previous unclear was how blood got from arteries to veins (to get back to heart). Harvey's theory suggested that there should be vessels, but they were too small to see.

Discovery / Invention: First demonstration of static electricity at scale
Notes: Inspired by attractive forces from rubbing amber (elektron in Greek), Guericke built a sulfur globe that could be rotated to generate a lot of static electricity and then produce sparks.

Discovery / Invention: Scientific chemistry, definition of chemical elements
Notes: 2000 years after Aristotle's 4 elements, published "The Skeptical Chymist", changing the name alchemist => chemist.  Suggested defining elements as components that can't be converted into anything simpler.

Discovery / Invention: Acid-base balance is necessary for health
Notes: Supplanted the 4 humor theory (bile, blood, phlegm, black bile) with acid-base balance. Suggested digestion was more chemical than mechanical.
Experiments in compressing gas showed an inverse relationship between volume and pressure in gas.
The English Royal Society became the first scientific society, other nations modeled theirs after it.

Discovery / Invention: Jupiter's Great Red Spot first observed
Notes: It's so huge the whole Earth could fit inside.
Published Micrographia which outlined his work. Looked at structure of cork, saw dead cells.
First inkling that light may have wave like properties.

Discovery / Invention: All planets rotate around their own axes
Notes: Discovered that Mars has a period of 24h40m, Jupiter 9h56m.
Used a prism to see a band of colors emerge from white light. Then used another prism to recombine it back into white light.

Discovery / Invention: Conservation of momentum in a closed system
Notes: Momentum (p=mv) must be conserved in a closed system. First of the fundamental conservation laws.
Devised a biological experiment with controls (first of its kind) to see if spoiled meat in a sealed flask would generate maggots. Answer: no.
Previous refracting telescopes suffered from chromatic abberation (which Newton studied in detail with prisms). New design used a curved mirror instead of a lens.
Working out laws of gravity, Newton needed a new mathematical tool. Simultaneous discovery with Liebnitz, led to epic scientific conflict for centuries.
Nine modern elements were known at the time (eg. gold) but their discoverers were unknown. Brand discovered Phosphorus in an attempt to create gold out of urine.

Discovery / Invention: Fossils first identified as petrified remnants of life
Notes: View eventually prevailed. Spectacular evidence of evolution.
Also known as birefringence, the phenomenon involves multiple paths of light going through a calcite prism. One of the paths is polarized. (TIL)
His work Tractatus de Corde first documented that dark red blood in veins turned brighter red from contact with air.
May have been known by ancients that diabetic urine was sweet from all of the flies that accumulated.

Discovery / Invention: Four moons of saturn first observed
Notes: Huygens thought that the 6 known satellites (4 around Jupiter, Titan around Saturn and Moon around Earth) matched the 6 known planets, so that was that. Cassini proved him wrong.

Discovery / Invention: Good estimate for distance to Mars obtained
Notes: Two millenium before, estimates of distance to Moon was established, but no other astronomical distances since. Cassini determined position of Mars as seen from Paris. Also determined size of solar system in general. Calculated Saturn orbit (farthest known planet) was at least 1.6e9 miles across

Galileo tried to record speed of light, but failed. Roemer observed Jupiter's satellites from Paris Observatory, found eclipses were earlier at times of year when Earth was approaching Jupiter, and later when receding. Estimated c to be 3/4 of its actual value.

Discovery / Invention: Discovery that Saturn has multiple rings
Notes: Cassini observed a dark line separating inner and outer ring. Known as "cassini's division"

Discovery / Invention: First observation of microorganisms in pond water
Notes: Used small single lenses ground expertly to produce 200x magnification. Observed "animalcules" in pond water. Also first detected spermatazoa in semen.

Discovery / Invention: First systematic observations of southern skies
Notes: Southern sky was never visible to Europeans. Halley traveled to St. Helena in south Atlantic, returned with a catalog of 341 southern stars.
Light: particle or wave controversy grew sharper. Newton couldn't see how light was a wave (there is nothing to wave), Huygens thought light traveled through an aether.
First useful application of steam. Tightly fitted lid increased boiling point of water to cook meat faster.
Modeled human bone and muscle as a system of levers, applying the same laws of physics to our body.
Mauritius had many species that evolved in isolation and were different from elsewhere. Dodo had no natural predators until the Dutch came and gradually killed them all.

Discovery / Invention: Some plants shown to reproduce sexually
Notes: Showed that plants have sexual organs, that plant pollen is equivalent to animal sperm. Previously, plants were assumed to be semi-alive (eg. in Genesis, they appear alongside dry land)
Continuing to rely on his excellent lenses, saw even smaller organisms than "animalcules", which in retrospect turned out to be bacteria.
Improvement over Eratosthenes' estimate based on distance of a star from zenith at different places using the help of telescopes. Estimate for radius was 3950 miles (actual 3,958.8)
First used the complex plane to represent i=sqrt(-1).

Discovery / Invention: First world map showing consistent winds
Notes: Seasonal winds called monsoons come from the arabic word meaning "season". These and steady winds were never documented before. Halley hinted at sun-heated air but didn't understand reason for westward flow.
Published a volume classifying 18600 different plant species, including a pretty good taxonomy.

Since Kepler discovered eliptical orbits, many scientists tried to understand the underlying laws. Eventually Newton published Principia, widely considered greatest science book ever written. Included three laws of motion.
Formulation of the force of gravity between any two bodies (that F=G m1 m2 / d^2) explained bodies in known universe.

Discovery / Invention: Earth shape suggested as oblate spheroid
Notes: When Richer traveled to Cayenne to determine Mars parallax, found pendelum beats slower there than in Paris. Newton suggested that this was due to difference in gravity at equator vs. at poles. This would mean earth would bulge.

Discovery / Invention: Techniques for making glass without blowing
Notes: Clear glass was a luxury until in France, large sheets of glass were made for mirrors and windows, and went into widespread use.
Classified animals logistically based on hooves, toes, and teeth.
Built the Step Reckoner, a mechanical aid to calculation of trig and astronomical tables.
He produced a life table showing the number of people surviving to any age from a cohort born the same year

Discovery / Invention: Miner's Friend invented to pump water out of flooded mines
Notes: Steam-powered air pump to help English coal mining, which was increasingly relied upon because of shortage of wood.

Discovery / Invention: First ocean voyage exclusively for science
Notes: Prior, voyages were taken for exploration, settlement or trade, with science as a side-effect. Halley's voyage measured magnetic declinations around the world, prepared first map of the world showing isodeclination, and accurate lat/long for ports.

Discovery / Invention: Discovery that volume of gas proportional to temperature
Notes: A step towards gas laws, but not quite precise enough measurements yet.
First use of non-decimal bases (8, 12) as well as binary system.
